strings.Value: "Hargulka is alive — he still rules. Go to him, and you will never have to be hungry or lonely again. You'll be able to have your own children."
"I didn't want his death... Kargadd gave me no choice. We don't need to fight. I spared you once — let's part in peace this day, too."
"It was nice seeing you. I have to go."
"I gave you a chance, but you didn't take it. Only by killing you can I be sure you won't harm innocents... to arms!"
"Letting you live was a mistake. Death to trolls!"
"We see you before. Borba kill father Kargadd."
"No. You kill Kargadd... And Karga and Argadd kill you."
{n}Ekun's face becomes cold. Only his narrowed eyes show what is going on in his soul.{/n}
"No peace. You don't kill Kargadd, he kill you. You don't kill us then — we kill you now."
{n}Ekun takes an arrow out of the quiver. His soft voice is painfully distinct in the sudden silence.{/n} "And still I was right."
"Borba are for eating. We kill you, kill your other borba, then kill everyone..."
"We be alone long time. Hungry, wait, search. Now borba be here."
{n}The silence seems to last forever. Tiny troll eyes are hungrily peering at you — obviously craving your blood. Finally, one of them speaks.{/n} "Good, borba. All right."
{n}Ekun clenches his fists.{/n} "By sparing them you doom innocents to die. I do not understand why."
